subject: Horse Racing
Auctions
lead_paragraph: Gross receipts at Keeneland’s September yearling sale totaled nearly $400 million, making the 14-day sale the highest-grossing thoroughbred auction in the world. The $399,791,800 total was a 4 percent increase over 2005’s record of $384,349,900 at Keeneland. One yearling, a colt by Kingmambo, sold for $11.7 million, a sale record, and 32 yearlings sold for $1 million or more.
